title: Yesssssss
pros: Yesssssss you can make money here
cons: It is very long hours and many days a week

title: Long-term employee POV
pros: During much of my time I worked in a stable environment. I had great support from my direct leadership and my projects were funded as needed. It was a challenging environment where I was expected to deliver consistent results. And that was something that I welcomed. You were paid well and the benefits were good. I worked with many great employees during my time.
cons: Starting around 2007 the company changed. Senior management changed out and several former GP employees were brought in. Many felt the organization should run like GP. The problem was that Rayonier wasn't organized like GP & didn't have the resources to do what they did. Instead of honoring long-term values, the company changed. It became a very political organization where results did not matter as much as appearances. In time, several GP employees left & the company had to take drastic steps in splitting up.

title: Great People, Rewards and Recognizes Hard Work
pros: Rayonier has a management approach that empowers employees in a way I haven't seen before. If you see an inefficient process, even if it's the way it's always been done, they encourage you to challenge the old way and give you the opportunity to prove the new way is better. While no place is perfect, I find here that most people get along really well, and we're getting better and better at crossing lines between departments and working together in a really beneficial way. They have a good rewards system to recognize employees who go above and beyond, pay a nice bonus once a year and benefits are good with a match on your 401k contributions.
cons: One challenge the company has is keeping the momentum going in all of its many locations -- so, for example, is the culture and enthusiasm the same in one office as it is in another? The company is definitely working on making the many offices all feel like one culture though.

title: Dont do it...
pros: Most of the hourly workers are friendly and dependable. They do offer a good amount of benefits which will come in time.
cons: Management lies to employees constantly. You don't know who to trust or who to speak to. You're scolded for trying to point out obvious things that are safety concerns and need Improvement. They are unionized but the union is very weak. They recently adopted a new labor contract stating that all new hires will forfeit 20% of their starting salary for the first two years of employment. In exchange for that the existing members that have worked there for a good link. Of time gain a bonus week of vacation and sick leave each year. I don't agree with the policies in the way the corporation is ran as a whole.

title: Worst experience ever
pros: Competitive pay scale. Good benefits. Could be a great job/ company if a few bad apples were culled out.
cons: Zero work life balance. Leadership is terrible. You will be on the road a lot using your own vehicle. You are looked down upon for wanting to have a life outside of work. Worst company I have ever worked for. No HR department.

title: I truly miss my Rayonier family
pros: During my time at Rayonier the management was truly concerned about the individual employees development and engagement within the company. In any meeting big or small every employee was encouraged to speak up and there were no wrong questions or answers. Before Diversity and Inclusion were big buzz words in business I feel that Rayonier was already living by these standards.
cons: The base pay was fair but not as high as some others in the same industry/region pay. The terrific environment, bonuses and perks did help to make up for this.

title: Engineer
pros: Competitive salary and benefits. Fernandina has a good location for raising a family.
cons: Upper management seems bent on putting down employees and creating a negative work environment. When business supposedly poor they limit or eliminate annual raises while taking multi million dollar bonuses. When business is good they don't make up for past restrictions and site the competitive market to keep raises and advancement low. Long work hours and weekend call ins are the norm. It's an old place that constantly is breaking down. Benefits have been slowly eroding over the years.

title: Process Engineer
pros: Rayonier AM is a forward-thinking company which offers its employees many professional development opportunities and diverse career paths. RYAM "plays by the rules" specifically regarding safety and environmental compliance. Employees are encouraged to consider using new technologies and processes to operate more efficiently. Raises are merit-based and, in my experience, very reasonable.
cons: The company has recently experienced some financial difficulties and has eliminated many positions as a result. Every dollar spent is challenged and carefully scrutinized.

title: A Great Place to Start Your Career
pros: Great training opportunities, local and national. Really interested in training employees across the US and allowing for lots of travel. Opportunity for growth if willing to relocate to remote locations, let me stress REMOTE. Great at training entry level employees, better than other similar timber companies.
cons: Remote working locations, corporate culture focused on bottom line above all else, little interest in long term employee development and will make you move to remote places you don't want to be. Pay below industry standards.

title: I've been here 21 years, it is a good, strong, stable company with good people working with me.
pros: Rayonier is very flexible, the people are honest with you, you know where you stand.
cons: ervative, so we make it through the tough times and excel in good times.

title: Union + Company Benefits
pros: Great pay Flexible hours Convenient location Appreciation from supervisors
cons: Corporate disconnect Stark salary gap Shut down layoffs OT = higher taxes

title: One of the best companies you can work for
pros: People within each department our tremendously helpful. Pay is above average. There was a real emphasis (in my department) on work/life balance. There was also an emphasis on employee improvement.
cons: Some people are resistant to change but that's any job.

title: Rayonier is a high class sweatshop
pros: Rayonier's salary compensation is at market levels. It's bonus program for non-executives is not. Rayonier has a strong set of ethics.
cons: Rayonier cares much more about production and productivity than it does about employees. Employees commonly work very long hours and over weekends and holidays. It is common for employees to be performing tasks and roles that would normally be handled by 2 or more individuals. Work/Life balance is non-existent. Not an enjoyable place to work.

title: Great company!
pros: Rayonier is an awesome company to work for! Everything from the benefits to fact that they always take employees into consideration when making company wife policy changes is amazing. It’s hard to find employers like that!
cons: Currently, none! It truly is a great place to work. Only con that comes to mind is not having group lunches anymore because of Covid, but that’s not their fault.

title: Rayonier is a great company to work for.
pros: The company has a solid benefits plan including good insurance and a matching HSA contribution. There is an annual bonus, and an extended match to your 401K. Also the new HQ is an incredible environment with a corporate gym.
cons: Frequent reorganization and transition in the company. Little room for career growth within the company. Someone has to retire or move on.

title: When times are good it's a great company
pros: Salary, benefits. Takes care of employees. A good business with a product in demand. Full of long term employees with loyalty to the company.
cons: Some questionable decisions at the top. Unfortunately these decisions have caused the stock to dump. Spent a ton on new manufacturing line the wrote it off.

title: Not a good company to work for as a minority
pros: Annual raise and bonus, however not worth the treatment
cons: The company supports and encourages unethical, bias and unfair treatment from managers. With over 300 employees, Rayonier has less than 15 minorities. Employees should not be intimidated or afraid to report unfair treatment by their manager. The company's values doesn't match their branding.

title: Rewarding job managing very good people
pros: Good work life balance, excellent benefits and compensation. flexible hours with some ability to work from home.
cons: Often go for short wins without considering long term goals. This leads to communication gaps and poor decisions.

title: Fast paced, interesting and solid.
pros: Company has lots of promotional opportunities and geographic diversity. Growing business with strong bottom line and focus on execution. Very skilled and competent workforce.
cons: Management reluctant to let go of lower level strategic planning or decision making. Burdensome administrative functions. Benefits mediocre.

title: Great Place to work!
pros: Supportive management and positive work environment. Beautiful HQ with open workspace environment to facilitate communication. They are dedicated to increasing employee knowledge about the business and industry.
cons: Heavy workload but management is supportive which makes getting it all done possible

title: It’s all relative – Individual results will vary.
pros: IT, accounting, Performance fibers, good dividend, forested holdings, decent benefits. Depending on what department you go to, it’s hard to say what’s good or bad. I will say the I.T. & I.T. related folks & most all accounting folks are world class.
cons: (won’t apply in all departments) counter - productive culture, assuming direction at times, double standards, limited advancement opportunities, , hypocrisy, Compensation/advancement/duties/flexibility based on cronyism/nepotism, mediocre communication, inconsistent bureaucracy; lack of identity (copying/obsessing about other competitors activities), little applicable training/inefficient hardware, “information is power” mentality reducing forward progress, you’ll have multiple bosses; all which do not effectively communicate with one another, resource shortage/inefficient delegation yielding large unmanageable workload, feigning.

title: Rayonier Employment
pros: Not many Pros. Hiring new management from the outside (ex IP or GP) has completely changed the culture of Rayonier.
cons: With new management came their old ways of treating people. Almost overnight, employees (especially long term) were treated with a great deal of disrespect. There was no acknowledgement of the fact that these folks had been doing something right, as Rayonier was one of the survivors in the forest products industry.

title: Old timers don't know how to treat and welcome new employees into the company
pros: Benefits, stability, many locations in which to work, stock market reflects a strong company and good investment for your future.
cons: Outdated systems, poor training for new employees, THE SMELL at the pulp mills, poor performance awards, lack of understanding when it comes to taking days off for family or medical related appointments, shortage or resources creates a large unmanageable workload.
